title: Iterator of `slice` has poor performance than `for loop`

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

body:
[I've made a simple performance test](https://github.com/tuxzz/t.rust-speed-test) ([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=a05bb448060e7634a4a908d12191cf2b&version=nightly&mode=release&edition=2018))

On my machine

|          Test          | Time(s) |
|------------------------|---------|
|       slice_iter       |  0.875  |
|   slice_loop_safe_bad  |  0.519  |
|  slice_loop_safe_good  |  0.298  |

On playground

|          Test          | Time(s) |
|------------------------|---------|
|       slice_iter       |  1  |
|   slice_loop_safe_bad  |  0.537  |
|  slice_loop_safe_good  |  0.304  |

Iterate over a slice is about **3x slower** than `for loop` and about **2x slower** than bad implemention of `for loop`. (and about **7x slower** than `unchecked for loop` on my test, but it uses unsafe)
Maybe a bug?
